Neuroscience.structures.Abstract_Neuron¶

class Neuroscience.structures.Abstract_Neuron.Abstract_Neuron(res, inputs, outputs, instance_count='')[source]¶

Bases: Neuroscience.structures.Organ.Organ

A class representing an abstract neuron model used in computational neuroscience.

The Abstract_Neuron class simulates the behavior of a neuron, focusing on synaptic potentials, membrane potential dynamics, and action potentials. It can be used as a building block for more complex neural network structures.

Act_Pot_time = 50¶

Duration of an action potential pulse (in simulation steps), including the refractory period.

.

Act_Pot_volt = 86.9¶

Peak voltage (mV) during an action potential.

.

EPSP(index, t, weight)[source]¶

Calculates the Excitatory Post-Synaptic Potential (EPSP) for a given dendrite.

This method simulates the potential that will be added up, and if the threshold is reached (15 mV), it fires the neuron.

Parameters

  • index (int) – Index of the dendrite receiving the EPSP.

  • t (float) – Time step at which the EPSP is calculated.

  • weight (float) – Synaptic weight associated with the dendrite.

Returns

The voltage change due to the EPSP at the specified dendrite.

Return type

float

.

EPSP_time = 150¶
Duration (in simulation steps) of an Excitatory Post-Synaptic Potential (EPSP), including

charge, stable response, and discharge phases.

.

IPSP(index, t, weight)[source]¶

Calculates the Inhibitory Post-Synaptic Potential (IPSP) for a given dendrite.

This method simulates the potential that will be subtracted, and if the threshold is reached (15 mV), it fires the neuron.

Parameters

  • index (int) – Index of the dendrite receiving the IPSP.

  • t (float) – Time step at which the IPSP is calculated.

  • weight (float) – Synaptic weight associated with the dendrite.

Returns

The voltage change due to the IPSP at the specified dendrite.

Return type

float

.

IPSP_time = 150¶
Duration (in simulation steps) of an Inhibitory Post-Synaptic Potential (IPSP), including

charge, stable response, and discharge phases.

.

Thres_Act_Pot_volt = 14.9¶

Threshold voltage (mV) required to fire the neuron.

.

active_potential(t)[source]¶

Simulates the action potential over the time period t.

This method includes both the action potential and the refractory period.

Parameters

t (float) – Time step for which the action potential is being calculated.

Returns

The membrane potential at time t during the action potential.

Return type

float

.

assign_input()[source]¶

Assigns an available dendrite to a connecting neuron.

Returns

The index of the assigned dendrite. Returns -1 if no dendrite is available.

Return type

int

.

connect_with_neuron(target_neuron)[source]¶

Establishes a connection between this neuron and a target neuron.

This is done by linking an axon terminal to the target neuron’s dendrite.

Parameters

target_neuron (Abstract_Neuron) – The target neuron to connect to.

.

get_voltage()[source]¶

Gets the current voltage values for each dendrite.

Returns

An array of voltage values for each dendrite.

Return type

numpy.ndarray

.

instanciation_counter = 0¶

A class-level counter that tracks the number of Abstract_Neuron instances created.

.

is_connected(n)[source]¶

Checks if this neuron is already connected to the given neuron n.

Parameters

n (Abstract_Neuron) – The neuron to check connection with.

Returns

True if connected, False otherwise.

Return type

bool

.

membrane_potential = 0¶
The membrane potential of the neuron, initially set to zero. The neuron fires when this potential

exceeds the threshold voltage.

.

present_inputs(inputs)[source]¶

Processes incoming inputs at the current time step.

This method checks if an active potential is occurring, and if not, updates the neuron’s state based on the inputs.

Parameters

inputs (list of int) – List of inputs for each dendrite. Values should be 1 for excitatory input, -1 for inhibitory input, or 0 for no input.

.

res = 0.1¶

The resolution of the simulation, affecting the time steps.

.

reset_PSP()[source]¶

Resets all Post-Synaptic Potentials (PSPs) to their default (inactive) states.

.

reset_axon_terminals()[source]¶

Turns off all axon terminals, indicating no active signaling.

.

set_weights(values)[source]¶

Sets the synaptic weights for each dendrite.

The weights must be such that the output voltage remains within physiological limits.

Parameters

values (list of float) – List of weights to be set for each dendrite.

.

spatial_summation()[source]¶

Performs spatial summation on all dendrites of the neuron.

This method updates the membrane potential based on the combined inputs from all active synapses. If the membrane potential exceeds the threshold, the neuron fires an action potential.

Returns

The updated membrane potential after spatial summation.

Return type

float

.

tau = 1.0857¶
Time constant (ms) used in the exponential functions for charging and discharging potentials.

This influences the duration of EPSPs and IPSPs.

.
